source.521ab4c8:
##Setting Working Directory 

setwd("/cloud/project/Fitabase Data 4.12.16-5.12.16")

## Loading CSV Files

install.packages("readr")
library("readr")

DailyActivity <- read.csv("dailyActivity_merged.csv")
sleepDay_merged <- read.csv("sleepDay_merged.csv")

## Installing Data Cleaning Packages

install.packages("tidyverse")
library("tidyverse")

## Scanning the Data in the Global Enviroment Tab

DailyActivity %>% count(Id)
sleepDay_merged %>% count(Id)

## Removing All Null Values In The Data Sets

DailyActivity <- na.omit(DailyActivity)
sleepDay_merged <- na.omit(sleepDay_merged)

is.na(DailyActivity)
is.na(sleepDay_merged)

## There are currently 33 unique Id's and 940 rows in Daily Activity
  and 24 unique Id's and 413 rows for Sleep Day.
  
n_distinct(DailyActivity$Id)
n_distinct(sleepDay_merged$Id)

nrow(DailyActivity)
nrow(sleepDay_merged)

## Sumarizing Exisitng Data

DailyActivity %>%  
  select(TotalSteps,
         TotalDistance,
         SedentaryMinutes) %>%
  summary()

sleepDay_merged %>%  
  select(TotalSleepRecords,
         TotalMinutesAsleep,
         TotalTimeInBed) %>%
  summary()
source.79b802c1:
ggplot(data=DailyActivity, aes(x=TotalSteps, y=Calories)) + geom_point()
ggplot(data=DailyActivity, aes(x=TotalSteps, y=SedentaryMinutes)) + geom_point()
source.9ab317cf:
combined_data <- merge(sleepDay_merged, DailyActivity, by="Id",all=TRUE)
n_distinct(combined_data$Id)

ggplot(data=combined_data, aes(x=TotalMinutesAsleep, y=TotalSteps)) + geom_smooth () 
    +  labs(title = 'Total Minutes Asleep vs Total Steps Per Day', 
            x = 'Total Minutes Asleep', y = 'Daily Total Steps')
source.5f8af253:
*Sleep* 

For the Sleep data set we measured for the correlation between *Total Minutes Asleep* to the *Total Time In Bed*.
source.ec30f471:
*Merging Data Sets*

To understand how sleeping habits impacts daily activity we merged the data sets by user ID to control for duplicate participants. We ran an outer-join merge in order to keep all data from exisitng participants in both data sets since Daily Activity had 33 and Sleep Day only 24.
source.faaf44ba:
**Preparing the Data**

*Participants & Measures*

The data was provided by *[FitBit Fitness Tracker Data](http://https://www.kaggle.com/arashnic/fitbit)*. The data is plubic domain and was made available through [Mobius](http://https://www.kaggle.com/arashnic). All responses collected came from 33 unique Fitbit users. All users consented to be a part of the data collection process. The personal tracker data collected measured for the following: daily activties, daily steps, heart rate, and sleep.

*Cleaning the Data*

By scanning and cleaning the datasets we can verify the integrity of the data. Once cleaned and verified we are able to run all analyses.

In this session we first scanned the data set in the Global Environment Tab to check for mispelling, any missing values, or data that may have been entered incorectly. Once scanning is complete we moved forward with removing all null values and verifying that all were removed. Afterwards we procedded with summarizing the data sets to ensure everything was ready to run analyses.
source.86efb40b:
**Analyzing the Data**

***Plotting a Few Explorations***

*Daily Activity*

For the Daily Activity data set we first measured the relationship between amount of *Total Steps* walked and the amount of *Calories* burned. We then measured for the correlation between amount of *Total Steps* and S*edentary Mintues*.
source.24d202ef:
# <center> **BELLABEAT**
# <center> Google Data Analytics Certificate Capstone Project
**Introduction**

Bellabeat, cofounded by Urška Sršen and Sando Mur, is small company that focuses on manufacturing high-tech & health-focused products for women. Some of these products include the “Leaf”, a wellness tracker, “Time”, a wellness watch, and “Spring”, a water bottle that can track your daily water intake. The company has come as for to developing the “Bellabeat app” that allows their users to keep track of their health-related data such as exercising activities they complete, sleep cycles, stress, and menstrual cycles. Bellabeat also offers month-to-month memberships that allows their users to fully personalize and track their nutrition, exercise, sleep, health, beauty, and mindfulness.

**Current Project**

For this current project we have been asked by Bellabeat’s cofounders Urška Sršen and Sando Mur, and Bellabeat’s marketing analytics team to gain better insights on how current Bellabeat product consumers use their products and then provide insightful recommendations for continued growth and future marketing strategies. 

We will be analyzing smart device usage from non-Bellabeat smart devices to later compare them to that of Bellabeat’s to answer the following questions:

1. What are some trends in smart device usage?
    
2. How could these trends apply to Bellabeat customers?
    
3. How could these trends help influence Bellabeat marketing strategy?
